1.title: New World Disorder

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: As a Democratic majority in the House puts a check on the Trump presidency, the second half of his term has begun with total gridlock, a government shutdown, and federal workers lining up for free hot meals. Is this the new normal?

2.title: Circling Vultures

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: President Trump's increasing vulnerability has led to a bumper crop of potential 2020 challengers, all of whom are hoping to be the one to unseat him.

3.title: The State of Our Union Is...

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: President Trump weighs declaring a state of emergency at the border, and the House Intelligence Committee is ramping up investigations of Trump on multiple fronts, and collaborating with Robert Mueller's team.

4.title: States of Emergency

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot:

1.title: The Outsiders

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: The campaigns of three "outsiders" - Sen. Ted Cruz, Sen. Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump - are given behind-the-scenes attention on the road to the Iowa caucus. Series premiere.

2.title: Prisoner's Dilemma

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Sen. Marco Rubio, Gov. Chris Christie, former Gov. Jeb Bush and Gov. John Kasich prepare for the all-important, first-in-the-nation primary in New Hampshire.

3.title: Tension City

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: Follows the angst and drama leading up to the Iowa caucuses, with a showdown brewing between Democrats Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton and the GOP's first real test of outsider candidates versus the establishment.

4.title: The Big Mo

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: The fourth episode goes inside the Iowa fallout and the momentum leading into New Hampshire's primary. Who's got it? Who doesn't? And how can the Clinton and Trump campaigns pick up the pace to beat back the surge of Sanders and Cruz?

5.title: The Winnowing

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: From the electric jolt of New Hampshire to the hard truths coming up in South Carolina and Nevada. Trump tastes victory, Kasich picks up momentum - and Bush faces the prospect of an impending do-or-die reality.

6.title: Fear and Loathing

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: Anxiety grows about how high the stakes are in Nevada and South Carolina.

7.title: Confidence Game

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

7.plot: Down to The Big Five, all eyes are on the upcoming prize: Super Tuesday.

8.title: The Reckoning

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

8.plot: With big wins for the front-runners on Super Tuesday the rest of candidates are reckoning with the results. But the biggest story of all might be one both Democratic and Republican establishments can agree on: how do they stop Trump?

9.title: Dead or Alive

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

9.plot: It's make or break time for Rubio, Kasich and Sanders. As the candidates pin their hopes on Florida and Ohio, can they gather enough momentum to force a brokered convention - or will their campaigns finally run out of steam?

10.title: High Hopes

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

10.plot: While Rubio gets trumped in Florida, the rest of the candidates remain cautiously optimistic. But are high hopes what they need to pull off a win and secure the nomination - or are they just delusional?

11.title: Home and Abroad

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

11.plot: As foreign policy comes to the fore can Trump and Clinton handle the heat?

12.title: On, Wisconsin

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

12.plot: Before a showdown in Wisconsin, candidates travel the state to pursue competing agendas; Kasich, Cruz and Sanders seek to secure their positions as spoilers.

13.title: Circus Recap

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

13.plot: From the early primary battles to the Super Tuesday showdown and beyond, pull back the curtain on the 2016 presidential race with Mark Halperin, John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon - and catch-up on the electrifying first twelve weeks.

14.title: Game On

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

14.plot: While the nation celebrates July 4, Trump and Clinton engage in their own fireworks. With the reemergence of Clinton's email scandal and Trump's latest faux pas, the titans go on the attack to take each other down.

15.title: Veepstakes

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

15.plot: No president is complete without a veep. As Trump auditions Chris Christie, Mike Pence and Newt Gingrich and Clinton considers Tim Kaine, can the candidates find the right-hand man for the job who will make, not break, their campaign?

16.title: The Trump Show

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

16.plot: The political circus goes into overdrive as Trump is crowned the Republican nominee - and Melania, controversially, speaks! Capitalizing on his children to help humanize his image, can Trump plus Pence finally rally a unified party?

17.title: In the Arena

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

17.plot: The jeers and boos of Sanders diehards ring out in Philadelphia, before the Democrats at last make Hillary a historic nominee. But is shattering a glass ceiling enough for Clinton and Kaine to unite the party into a winning coalition?

18.title: Closing the Gap

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

18.plot: Examines the race, which has tightened significantly in the weeks, as it enters the final stage of the election with less than 60 days to go. It also examines third party candidate Governor Gary Johnson and the "Allepo" gaffe.

19.title: Fit to Serve

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

19.plot: As Clinton's pneumonia and scrutiny about Trump's medical records comes to the forefront, their fitness to lead is questioned.

20.title: Battleground

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

20.plot: As Clinton and Trump prepare for their first debate, their campaigns target the swing states with an eye on Florida.

21.title: Newsrooms

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

21.plot: Preparations for the debate; the candidates cede the spotlight to those who cover the political news.

22.title: Tale of the Tape

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

22.plot: The fallout from the second debate and the current scandal surrounding a recently publicized audio tape.

23.title: From Russia with Love

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

23.plot: Amid claims of foreign intervention, international espionage and widespread hacking, Clinton faces what might turn out to be her toughest opponent to date: WikiLeaks, and the trove of highly sensitive, private emails it's made public.

24.title: His Word as a Biden

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

24.plot: The final two-week push going into the election sees the full weight of the White House come out in force for Clinton's campaign, including one man who has the potential to swing those states still up for grabs: Joe Biden.

25.title: Nobody Fucking Knows

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

25.plot: The first real-time documentary series about an American presidential campaign returns, going behind the scenes as Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump battle it out in the final stretch to the election. Political journalists Mark Halperin, John Heilemann and media advisor Mark McKinnon pull back the curtain to take viewers inside the fiercest competition on earth - where the ultimate prize is the most powerful office in the world.

26.title: President Trump

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

26.plot: In a special hour-long episode of the real-time documentary series, Mark Halperin, John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon go behind the scenes of both campaigns in the lead up to Election Day - and the fallout that followed. Season Finale.

1.title: Shocking But Not Surprising

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: Mark Halperin takes a ride on Airforce One with President Donald Trump. We look at the debate surrounding the health-care bill and hear from both sides, including Sen. Ted Cruz, Sen. Rand Paul and the White House.

2.title: Checking and Balancing

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Mark Halperin talks with Senator Patrick Leahy about Neil Gorsuch's Supreme Court nomination, Congressman Adam Schiff weighs in on Trump's alleged ties to Russia and Joe Biden enters the fray surrounding the healthcare bill.

3.title: How's He Doing?

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: What do people outside the Beltway really think about President Trump? Mark Halperin takes a trip through America to find the answers. Then he heads to New Orleans to discuss his surprising findings with Mary Matalin.

4.title: The Whole World Is Watching

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: What in the world is going on? This week is all about foreign policy: President Trump's military response to the use of chemical weapons in Syria and its impact on his ongoing delicate dance with Russia.

5.title: Recess Reset

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: Congress may be in recess but Mark Halperin is on the job, covering the White House and the Syria fallout. John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon hit the road to see what Americans think about how President Trump is handling the situation.

6.title: The Resistance

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: How are the Democrats resisting Trump? Mark Halperin talks to Elizabeth Warren about standing strong. Bernie Sanders tells John Heilemann about taking his message to the people. Americans talk about what resistance means to them.

7.title: Learning Curve

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

7.plot: What has President Trump learned from his first 100 days in office? As Congress reconvenes, Mark McKinnon and John Heilemann head to Capitol Hill to find out. Mark Halperin is in New York City to get Wall Street's perspective.

8.title: Looking Back and Moving On

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

8.plot: Washington insiders join John Heilemann, Mark Halperin and Mark McKinnon for a look at some of the thrilling, amazing and logic defying acts performed during President Trump's first 100 days.

1.title: The Looking Glass War

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

1.plot: USA and Russia, locked in a dangerous new standoff, from Facebook and the 2016 election, to alleged poisonings, to Syria, there is Russia. John Heilemann, Mark McKinnon and new host Alex Wagner look at where this new Cold War is heading.

2.title: Too Many Lawyers

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

2.plot: Growing legal entanglements surround President Trump -f rom the ongoing Mueller investigation to the Michael Cohen raid and subsequent hearing, and James Comey's inflammatory book, the Trump presidency is under siege.

3.title: Man of the World

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

3.plot: As Mike Pompeo's nomination for Secretary of State clears a Senate hurdle, official visits from French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Angela Merkel command the administration's attention.

4.title: Trump Country

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

4.plot: The Circus goes on the road to Trump country to take the nation's temperature on the president's performance, how the midterm elections are shaping up, and where the two sides currently stand on gun control. John Heilemann catches up with Mitt Romney about his Utah senate campaign, Mark McKinnon interviews Randy "Iron Stache" Bryce in Wisconsin about his bid to turn Paul Ryan's district Democratic, and Alex Wagner travels to Texas for a sit-down with Beto O'Rourke on his surprisingly close race to unseat Republican Senator Ted Cruz.

5.title: War and Peace

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

5.plot: The gloves are off as Donald Trump fights a 360-degree battle to keep the presidency. He's taking shots at those who stand to threaten it, and is at war against the "deep state" of the FBI, CIA, and the Department of Justice. Stories covered include Michael Cohen's connection to a Russian oligarch, Trump's attempts to undermine the Mueller investigation, the scuttling of the Iran deal, and the Senate confirmation hearing for Trump's controversial CIA Director pick, Gina Haspel.

6.title: Their Brand is Crisis

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

6.plot: A look at the Trump White House in constant crisis mode. Also Chris Christie on trying to govern during a scandal; Steve Brill on combating fake news; Steve Schmidt and Mark Fabiani on the Trump administration crisis management.

7.title: The Gathering Storm

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

7.plot: With the looming midterm elections, the Trump presidency under relentless siege, and Hurricane Florence bearing down on the Carolina coast, Washington has a lot on its collective plate. Mark McKinnon and Alex Wagner visit the democratic and republican war rooms respectively, and learn what each camp is doing to secure the majority in the House. John Heilemann interviews Steve Bannon and takes a tour of Breitbart, all in advance of the release of Bannon's inflammatory new documentary.

8.title: Burden of Proof

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

8.plot: As Republicans and Democrats play a dramatic game of chess in the wake of the assault allegations from Christine Blasey Ford, all eyes are on the Senate Judiciary Committee and the confirmation process of Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court. Parallels are drawn between the current showdown and the Anita Hill hearing in 1991, and recurring contributor Steve Schmidt gives context to the Trump administration's response, given his experience working to confirm Supreme Court nominees for previous Republican administrations.

9.title: Judgment Day

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

9.plot: The focus remains tightly on the confirmation of Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court. For much of the week John Heilemann is embedded with attorney Michael Avenatti, who may just have the most explosive revelations of all.

10.title: The Verdict

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

10.plot: The emphasis remains squarely on the constantly-evolving story of the Brett Kavanaugh confirmation. But as the midterm elections draw nearer, hosts John Heilemann, Mark McKinnon, Alex Wagner and guest commentator Steve Schmidt delve into the ramifications of the confirmation's outcome on various Senate races around the country. Republicans and Democrats are riled up about this issue, and in states where the polls are close, Senate races could be affected by how the incumbents vote.

11.title: California Dreaming

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

11.plot: In the wake of the Kavanaugh confirmation, The Circus travels to California to take the temperature of the political and policy resistance to the Trump administration. With almost a dozen house seats currently held by Republicans in serious contention, any potential blue wave in the midterm elections will begin here. The hosts interview key players from across the political spectrum to determine the current state of California politics, how they got where they are, and where they are headed.

12.title: Senatorial Combat

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

12.plot: As the battle for the Senate heats up with post-Kavanaugh polls forecasting a Republican resurgence, The Circus travels the country charting the shifting dynamics in three of the closest races - each considered a must-win if Democrats hope to gain the majority. In Arizona, it's neck and neck between Kyrsten Sinema and Martha McSally; in Nevada, Jacky Rosen digs deep to take on incumbent Dean Heller; plus, a sit-down with North Dakota's Heidi Heitkamp, who's fighting for her political life in the wake of a campaign ad controversy.

13.title: Black and White

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

13.plot: As undertones of racial politics make news, The Circus travels to Florida and Georgia, following two historic gubernatorial races with African-American candidates.

14.title: A Place Called Fear

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

14.plot: With the midterm elections only days away, The Circus travels to rallies and campaign stops around the country to find out how both sides are pulling out all the stops to win these all-important races.

15.title: Mother(F***er) of All Midterms

episode of.title: The Circus: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth (TV Series 2016– )

15.plot: One-hour season finale all about the midterms: before, during and after.

imdb.plot outline: Come one, come all to THE CIRCUS: INSIDE THE GREATEST POLITICAL SHOW ON EARTH. This documentary series pulls back the curtain on the 2016 presidential race, revealing the intense, inspiring and infuriating stories behind the headlines. Key characters and events from the individual campaigns are presented in real time, as they are happening. Produced in cooperation with Bloomberg Politics, THE CIRCUS is a non-partisan, never-before-attempted take on what promises to be one of the most fascinating and consequential elections in modern history.

Produced in cooperation with Bloomberg Politics, THE CIRCUS is a non-partisan, never-before-attempted take on what promises to be one of the most fascinating and consequential elections in modern history.
